words.definition: To agree is to have the same opinion or belief as another person.
examples: My parents agree that we should save money for a new house.

words.definition: Alcohol is a type of drink that can make people drunk.
examples: The doctor told him to avoid drinking alcohol for his health.

words.definition: To arrive is to get somewhere.
examples: We expect the guests to arrive at the hotel by noon.

words.definition: August is the eighth month of the year.
examples: The weather is usually very hot in August.

words.definition: A boat is a vehicle that moves across water.
examples: They took a boat across the river to get to the island.

words.definition: Breakfast is the morning meal.
examples: Pancakes are my favorite food for breakfast.

words.definition: A camera is a piece of equipment that takes pictures.
examples: Don't forget to bring your camera to the zoo.

words.definition: A capital is a city where a country's government is based.
examples: Tokyo is the capital of Japan.

words.definition: To catch is to grab or get something.
examples: He ran fast to catch the bus before it left.

words.definition: A duck is a small water bird.
examples: The duck dove under the water to find a fish.

words.definition: To enjoy is to like something.
examples: We really enjoy walking in the park on sunny days.

words.definition: To invite is to ask someone to come to a place or event.
examples: I want to invite all my friends to my graduation party.

words.definition: To love is to like something or someone a lot.
examples: I love listening to classical music while I study.

words.definition: A month is one of 12 periods of time in one year.
examples: February is the shortest month of the year.

words.definition: To travel is to go to a faraway place on vacation or business.
examples: My dream is to travel to Italy and eat authentic pasta.

words.definition: If something is typical, it is normal, or something that usually happens.
examples: A typical lunch for me includes a sandwich and an apple.

words.definition: To visit is to go and spend time in another place or see another person.
examples: We will visit the museum tomorrow morning.

words.definition: Weather is the temperature and the state of the outdoors.
examples: The weather looks rainy, so take an umbrella.

words.definition: A week is a period of time that is seven days long.
examples: I have to finish this project within a week.

words.definition: Wine is an alcoholic drink made from grapes.
examples: They bought a bottle of expensive wine for the celebration.

words.definition: An adventure is a fun or exciting thing that you do.
examples: Camping in the mountains was a great adventure for the kids.

words.definition: To approach something means to move close to it.
examples: Be careful when you approach that wild dog.

words.definition: Carefully means with great attention, especially to detail or safety.
examples: She carefully painted the details on the small statue.

words.definition: A chemical is something that scientists use in chemistry.
examples: The scientist mixed the chemical with water to see the reaction.

words.definition: To create means to make something new.
examples: The chef wants to create a new menu for the summer.

words.definition: Evil describes something or someone bad or cruel, not good.
examples: In the story, the hero defeats the evil king.

words.definition: An experiment is a test that you do to see what will happen.
examples: We conducted a science experiment to learn about gravity.

words.definition: To kill someone or something is to make them die.
examples: Using pesticides can kill the helpful insects in the garden.

words.definition: A laboratory is a room where a scientist works.
examples: The researchers wear white coats in the laboratory.

words.definition: Laugh is the sound made when someone is happy or a funny thing occurs.
examples: Her jokes always make me laugh.

words.definition: If a sound is loud, it is strong and very easy to hear.
examples: The loud music from the party kept the neighbors awake.

words.definition: When a person is nervous, they think something bad will happen.
examples: He felt nervous before his job interview.

words.definition: A noise is an unpleasant sound.
examples: The car engine made a strange noise.

words.definition: A project is a type of work that you do for school or a job.
examples: The students worked together on a history project.

words.definition: To scare someone is to make them feel afraid.
examples: Don't hide behind the door to scare your sister.

words.definition: A secret is something that you do not tell other people.
examples: She whispered a secret into her best friend's ear.

words.definition: To shout is to say something loudly.
examples: The teacher had to shout to be heard over the noisy students.

words.definition: To smell something means to use your nose to sense it.
examples: I can smell the flowers in the garden from here.

words.definition: If something is terrible, it is very bad.
examples: The movie was terrible, so we left the theater early.

words.definition: If something is worse, it is of poorer quality than another thing.
examples: The traffic is worse today than it was yesterday.

words.definition: An alien is a creature from a different world.
examples: The movie is about an alien who visits Earth.

words.definition: If you are among certain things, they are all around you.
examples: He found his lost keys among the papers on his desk.

words.definition: A chart is a list of information.
examples: The doctor looked at the patient's chart.

words.definition: A cloud is a group of water drops in the sky.
examples: A dark cloud covered the sun before the storm.

words.definition: To describe is to say or write what someone or something is like.
examples: Can you describe the man who stole your bag?

words.definition: Ever means at any time.
examples: Have you ever been to Paris?

words.definition: To fail means you do not succeed in what you try to do.
examples: If you don't study, you might fail the exam.

words.definition: A grade is a score or mark given to someone's work.
examples: She studied hard to get a good grade in math.

words.definition: Instead means in place of.
examples: He ate fruit instead of candy for a snack.

words.definition: A library is a place where you go to read books.
examples: I went to the library to borrow a book about history.

words.definition: I like taking photographs.
examples: He took a beautiful photograph of the sunset.

words.definition: A planet is a large round thing in space.
examples: Mars is often called the Red Planet.

words.definition: A report is something someone writes for school or work.
examples: I have to finish my science report by Friday.

words.definition: Several is more than two but not many.
examples: He has visited that restaurant several times.

words.definition: An object's shape is the arrangement of its sides and surfaces.
examples: The cloud had the shape of a rabbit.

words.definition: To solve something is to find an answer to it.
examples: It took him a long time to solve the puzzle.

words.definition: If something happens suddenly, it happens quickly and unexpectedly.
examples: Suddenly, the lights went out during the storm.

words.definition: To suppose is to guess.
examples: I suppose she will be late because of the traffic.

words.definition: To understand something you need to know what it means.
examples: Do you understand the instructions for the game?

words.definition: To view is to look at something.
examples: People climbed the tower to view the city from above.

words.definition: When a thing is appropriate, it is right or normal.
examples: It is not appropriate to wear shorts to a formal wedding.

words.definition: To avoid something is to stay away from it.
examples: You should avoid walking alone in dark alleys at night.

words.definition: To behave is to act in a particular way, especially to be good.
examples: The children promised to behave well at the restaurant.

words.definition: When someone is calm, they do not get excited or upset.
examples: The mother remained calm even though the baby was crying.

words.definition: Concern is a feeling of worry.
examples: There is growing concern about pollution in the city.

words.definition: To be content is to be happy and not want more.
examples: He was content with his simple life in the village.

words.definition: If you expect something to happen, you believe it will happen.
examples: I expect the package to arrive tomorrow.

words.definition: When something happens frequently, it happens often.
examples: We frequently visit our grandparents on weekends.

words.definition: A habit is a thing that you do often.
examples: Biting your nails is a bad habit.

words.definition: To instruct is to teach.
examples: The coach will instruct the team on the new strategy.

words.definition: An issue is an important topic.
examples: Climate change is a major global issue.

words.definition: None means not any of something.
examples: He looked for cookies, but there were none left in the jar.

words.definition: If people are patient, they don't become angry or upset easily.
examples: You need to be patient when teaching a child to read.

words.definition: If something is positive, it is good.
examples: She has a very positive attitude towards her work.

words.definition: To punish means to make someone suffer for breaking the rules or laws.
examples: The teacher had to punish the student for cheating.

words.definition: To represent is to speak or act for a person or group.
examples: The athlete will represent her country in the Olympics.

words.definition: To shake is to move back and forth or up and down quickly.
examples: Don't shake the soda bottle before opening it.

words.definition: To spread is to move out to cover a larger area.
examples: The fire spread quickly through the dry forest.

words.definition: To stroll means to walk slowly and calmly.
examples: They decided to stroll along the beach at sunset.

words.definition: A village is a very small town.
examples: Everyone knows each other in the small village.

words.definition: When someone is active, they move a lot or have a lot of things to do.
examples: My grandmother is still very active and swims every day.

words.definition: An adult is a person who is more than 18 years old.
examples: You need an adult to sign this permission form.

words.definition: Age is how many years someone has lived.
examples: At the age of five, he started playing the piano.

words.definition: When something is bad, it is not good.
examples: Stealing is a bad thing to do.

words.definition: Balance is when two or more things are equal.
examples: It is important to keep a balance between work and fun.

words.definition: A bike is a vehicle with two wheels powered by a human.
examples: He rides his bike to work to save money on gas.

words.definition: To choose is to pick something or make a decision.
examples: You have to choose which color you want for your room.

words.definition: A doctor is a person who studies medicine and helps sick people.
examples: The doctor gave me medicine for my sore throat.

words.definition: During an event means while the event was happening.
examples: Please do not talk during the movie.

words.definition: Football is a sport with eleven members and an oval-shaped ball.
examples: We play football in the park every Sunday.

words.definition: When something is fun, it is enjoyable.
examples: Playing video games with friends is a lot of fun.

words.definition: A game is an activity where people compete against each other.
examples: Monopoly is a popular board game.

words.definition: A heart is an organ that keeps the body alive.
examples: Regular exercise is good for your heart.

words.definition: Golf is a sport with clubs and a small white ball.
examples: My dad plays golf every Saturday morning.

words.definition: To increase is to make something larger.
examples: The store decided to increase the price of milk.

words.definition: Life is the time when a person is alive.
examples: She lived a very happy life surrounded by family.

words.definition: A kilometer is a unit of measurement that is 1,000 meters.
examples: The nearest gas station is one kilometer away.

words.definition: Often is when something happens many times.
examples: I often go to the library to study.

words.definition: If you have plenty of something, there is a lot of it.
examples: We have plenty of food for the party, so don't worry.

words.definition: Weight is how heavy something or someone is.
examples: He lifted the heavy weight at the gym.

words.definition: When people or things are apart, they are not next to each other.
examples: Since he moved to another city, the two best friends have been living apart.

words.definition: An attribute is a characteristic of a person or thing.
examples: Honesty is a very important attribute in a leader.

words.definition: A bilingual person can speak two languages.
examples: Because her mother is French and her father is English, she is bilingual.

words.definition: Something completely different is very, very different from before.
examples: After the renovation, the old house looked completely new.

words.definition: To dash means to run or move quickly.
examples: I had to dash to the bus stop so I wouldn't be late for work.

words.definition: Disgust is a feeling of distaste and anger caused by something rude or unpleasant.
examples: She looked at the rotten food with disgust.

words.definition: Something fashionable is what people like to wear and do now.
examples: It is very fashionable to wear large sunglasses this summer.

words.definition: Something foreign is something we are not used to.
examples: When you travel, you often hear foreign languages spoken in the streets.

words.definition: A gulf is a gap between people who do not understand each other.
examples: There is a wide gulf between the opinions of the two political parties.

words.definition: A mirror is usually made of glass, and you can see yourself in it.
examples: He looked in the mirror to fix his tie before the meeting.

words.definition: Things that are natural are not made by people.
examples: We prefer to eat food with natural ingredients rather than chemicals.

words.definition: Nowadays means at the present time.
examples: Nowadays, almost everyone has a smartphone.

words.definition: A participant is someone who joins in a social event or competition.
examples: Every participant in the race received a medal.

words.definition: A ritual is a formal custom that people do regularly.
examples: Drinking coffee every morning is a daily ritual for my dad.

words.definition: Spoken language is what we say.
examples: Spoken English can be different from written English.

words.definition: Sport involves games like running, jumping, football, and tennis.
examples: Basketball is my favorite sport to play with friends.

words.definition: You are surprised when something unexpected happens.
examples: She was surprised to see her old friend at the party.

words.definition: When you are tense, you are not comfortable and feel unhappy.
examples: The students felt tense while waiting for their exam results.

words.definition: If you totally agree, you agree with everything just said.
examples: I totally forgot that today was your birthday.

words.definition: If something is vague, it is not clear and gives very few details.
examples: His explanation was too vague, so we didn't understand what to do.

words.definition: To allow something to happen means to let it happen.
examples: My parents do not allow me to stay out late on school nights.

words.definition: To announce something is to make it known.
examples: The company will announce the new manager tomorrow.

words.definition: Someone or something beside you is next to you.
examples: Come and sit beside me on the sofa.

words.definition: A challenge is something difficult to complete.
examples: Climbing the mountain was a big challenge for the team.

words.definition: To claim means to say that something is true.
examples: He claims that he can run faster than anyone else in the class.

words.definition: The condition of someone or something is the state that they are in.
examples: The used car is in very good condition.

words.definition: To contribute is to do something to make it successful.
examples: Everyone should contribute some money for the gift.

words.definition: A difference is a way that something is not like other things.
examples: The main difference between the twins is their hair style.

words.definition: To divide something is to split it into smaller parts.
examples: We need to divide the cake into eight equal pieces.

words.definition: An expert is someone who is very good at doing something.
examples: My uncle is an expert at fixing classic cars.

words.definition: A famous person or thing is well known.
examples: The Mona Lisa is a famous painting by Leonardo da Vinci.

words.definition: Force is a person's strength or power.
examples: He had to use force to open the stuck jar.

words.definition: To cause harm is to hurt someone or damage something.
examples: Please be careful not to harm the small animals.

words.definition: To lay means to put or place in a horizontal or flat position.
examples: Please lay the books on the table.

words.definition: Peace is a time without war.
examples: After years of fighting, the two countries finally made peace.

words.definition: A prince is the son of a king.
examples: The prince lived in a large castle with the king and queen.

words.definition: To protect someone is to stop them from getting hurt.
examples: Wearing a helmet helps protect your head while biking.

words.definition: To sense something is to know about it without being told.
examples: I could sense that she was sad even though she was smiling.

words.definition: When something is sudden, it happens very quickly.
examples: There was a sudden drop in temperature this afternoon.

words.definition: Therefore means for this reason.
examples: He didn't study; therefore, he failed the test.

words.definition: To accept something that is offered is to take it.
examples: I was happy to accept the invitation to the party.

words.definition: To arrange things is to put them in the right place.
examples: She likes to arrange the flowers in a beautiful vase.

words.definition: To attend something is to go to it.
examples: All students must attend the morning assembly.

words.definition: You chase people when you run after them and try to catch them.
examples: The cat likes to chase the mouse around the house.

words.definition: A contrast is a sharp difference between two things.
examples: There is a big contrast between the rich and poor parts of the city.

words.definition: To encourage people is to make them want to do something.
examples: My teacher always encourages me to read more books.

words.definition: People or things familiar to you are those you know well.
examples: That song sounds familiar; I think I've heard it before.

words.definition: To grab is to take a hold of someone or something suddenly.
examples: He had to grab his umbrella before running out into the rain.

words.definition: To hang something is to keep it above the ground.
examples: We will hang the picture on the wall above the sofa.

words.definition: If something is huge, it is very big.
examples: They saw a huge whale in the ocean.

words.definition: If something is necessary, you must do it.
examples: Water is necessary for all living plants.

words.definition: A pattern is a way in which something is done or organized.
examples: The shirt has a striped pattern of blue and white.

words.definition: To propose something is to say that it should be done.
examples: I propose we take a break and eat lunch now.

words.definition: A purpose is the reason that you do something.
examples: The purpose of this meeting is to discuss the new project.

words.definition: To release something is to stop holding it.
examples: He opened his hand to release the butterfly back into the garden.

words.definition: To require something is to say that it is necessary.
examples: Plants require sunlight and water to grow.

words.definition: You are satisfied when you have what you wanted.
examples: She was satisfied with her test score.

words.definition: If something is single, then there is only one.
examples: There was a single flower growing in the field.

words.definition: To tear something means to pull it apart.
examples: Be careful not to tear the paper when you open the gift.

words.definition: A theory is an idea about how something works.
examples: Darwin developed a theory about evolution.

words.definition: An animal is a living thing that can move.
examples: The zoo has many different types of wild animals.

words.definition: A bus is a large vehicle that people travel on.
examples: I take the bus to work because it is cheaper than driving.

words.definition: A cat is a small animal related to lions and tigers that is kept as a pet.
examples: My cat loves to sleep in the sun.

words.definition: A command is an order given to a person or animal to do something.
examples: The soldier followed the command of his captain.

words.definition: To depend on something is to need it for support or help.
examples: Babies depend on their parents for food and care.

words.definition: A dog is an animal with four legs and a tail that is kept as a pet or trained to work.
examples: The dog barked when the mail carrier arrived.

words.definition: A door is an object that swings or slides open and shut.
examples: Please close the door so the bugs don't come inside.

words.definition: A friend is someone a person knows and likes spending time with.
examples: I am going to the movies with my best friend.

words.definition: To hear is to be aware of sound through your ears.
examples: Can you hear the birds singing outside?

words.definition: To help is to do something that makes something easier for someone else.
examples: Can you help me carry these heavy bags?

words.definition: A horse is a big, strong animal that people ride and use for pulling heavy things.
examples: She learned to ride a horse on her grandfather's farm.

words.definition: A hospital is where sick or hurt people receive care or treatment.
examples: He had to go to the hospital when he broke his leg.

words.definition: A leg is a body part used for standing and walking.
examples: He hurt his left leg while playing soccer.

words.definition: Medical means related to the treatment of an injury or disease.
examples: She wants to go to medical school to become a doctor.

words.definition: To open is to move something so that an opening is not covered.
examples: Please open the window to let some fresh air in.

words.definition: To pull is to hold onto something to move it toward you.
examples: You have to pull the door handle to open it.

words.definition: A rabbit is a small animal with long ears that lives in a hole in the ground.
examples: The rabbit hopped across the garden eating carrots.

words.definition: A school is a place where children go to learn.
examples: Children start primary school when they are five years old.

words.definition: To see is to use your eyes to look at something or someone.
examples: I can see the mountains from my bedroom window.

words.definition: Service is the act of helping or serving someone.
examples: The service at this restaurant is excellent.

words.definition: A benefit is a good thing.
examples: One benefit of exercise is having more energy.

words.definition: If you are certain about something, you know it is true.
examples: I am certain that we will win the game.

words.definition: A chance is an opportunity to do something.
examples: If you hurry, you have a chance to catch the train.

words.definition: An effect is a change made by something else.
examples: Pollution has a negative effect on the environment.

words.definition: If something is essential, it is very important and necessary.
examples: It is essential to drink water every day.

words.definition: If something is far, it is not close.
examples: My house is far from the city center.

words.definition: To focus on something is to think about it and pay attention to it.
examples: It is hard to focus on homework when the TV is on.

words.definition: The function of something is what it does.
examples: The main function of the heart is to pump blood.

words.definition: Grass is the green leaves that cover the ground.
examples: We sat on the grass and had a picnic.

words.definition: To guard something is to take care of it.
examples: The dog will guard the house while we are away.

words.definition: The image of something is a picture of it.
examples: The artist drew an image of the beautiful landscape.

words.definition: If something is immediate, it happens quickly.
examples: The medicine gave him immediate relief from the pain.

words.definition: If something is primary, it is the most important thing.
examples: The primary reason for moving was to be closer to work.

words.definition: People who feel proud are happy about what they have done.
examples: She was very proud when she graduated from college.

words.definition: To remain somewhere is to stay there.
examples: He decided to remain at home instead of going out.

words.definition: To rest is to stop being active while the body gets back its strength.
examples: You should rest for a few days until your cold is gone.

words.definition: If two things are separate, they are not together.
examples: The boys sleep in separate bedrooms.

words.definition: A site is a place.
examples: This is the site where the new school will be built.

words.definition: A tail is a part of an animal's body that sticks out from its rear or back.
examples: The dog wagged its tail when it saw its owner.

words.definition: Trouble is a problem or a difficulty.
examples: She had trouble starting her car this morning.

words.definition: To advertise is to describe or draw attention to a product or event by using a public medium.
examples: Companies often advertise their new products on television and social media.

words.definition: If someone is aware, they know that something or a situation exists.
examples: He was not aware that the meeting had been canceled.

words.definition: A battery is an object placed inside something to supply it with electricity.
examples: My remote control stopped working because the battery was dead.

words.definition: Black is the darkest color.
examples: She wore a black dress to the formal dinner.

words.definition: A city is a place where a lot of people live.
examples: New York is a very busy city with tall buildings.

words.definition: To clean is to make something neat and tidy.
examples: We need to clean the kitchen before we start cooking.

words.definition: A country is an area of land with the same government and laws.
examples: Canada is a large country in North America.

words.definition: To develop is to make something larger or more advanced.
examples: The scientists want to develop a new medicine for the flu.

words.definition: If something is electric, it uses electricity.
examples: He bought an electric guitar to play in the band.

words.definition: When something happens at a later time or in the end, it happens eventually.
examples: If you keep practicing, you will eventually learn how to swim.

words.definition: A fact is a piece of information that is true.
examples: It is a fact that the Earth orbits around the sun.

words.definition: Glass is a transparent, breakable material.
examples: Be careful not to drop the vase because it is made of glass.

words.definition: History is the study of the past.
examples: We learned about the Roman Empire in our history class.

words.definition: Nature is everything in the physical world that is not made by people.
examples: They love hiking because they enjoy being close to nature.

words.definition: Never is when something is impossible or will not happen.
examples: I have never traveled to Australia, but I want to go someday.

words.definition: People are humans.
examples: Many people gathered in the square to watch the fireworks.

words.definition: Plastic is a material made by people.
examples: Please recycle your plastic bottles instead of throwing them away.

words.definition: A problem is a situation when something goes wrong.
examples: We have a problem with the car engine, so it won't start.

words.definition: A street is a road in a city or village.
examples: Look both ways before you cross the street.

words.definition: To think is to have an opinion or thought about something.
examples: I think that blue is the best color for the walls.

words.definition: A person who is alone is not with another person.
examples: She prefers to be alone when she is reading a book.

words.definition: An apartment is a set of rooms in a building where people live.
examples: They rented a small apartment in the city center.

words.definition: An article is a story in a newspaper or magazine.
examples: I read an interesting article about space travel yesterday.

words.definition: An artist is a person who paints, draws, or makes sculptures.
examples: The artist displayed his paintings in the gallery.

words.definition: Someone's attitude is the way they feel and think.
examples: He has a positive attitude even when things are difficult.

words.definition: Beauty is the state or quality of being beautiful.
examples: Everyone admired the beauty of the sunset over the ocean.

words.definition: To compare means to say how two things are the same and different.
examples: Before buying a phone, you should compare the prices of different models.

words.definition: To judge something is to say if it is good or bad.
examples: The teacher will judge the science fair projects tomorrow.

words.definition: A magazine is a regular publication with news, stories, and articles.
examples: She bought a fashion magazine to look at the new trends.

words.definition: A material is what is used to make something.
examples: Cotton is a soft material used to make clothes.

words.definition: A meal is a time when food is eaten, such as breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
examples: Thanksgiving dinner is my favorite meal of the year.

words.definition: A method is the way to do something.
examples: The teacher showed us a new method for solving math problems.

words.definition: A neighbor is a person who lives near you.
examples: My neighbor watered my plants while I was on vacation.

words.definition: If something is professional, it deals with work that uses special skills.
examples: You should seek professional advice before investing your money.

words.definition: A profit is the extra money you make when you sell something.
examples: The company made a large profit this year.

words.definition: The quality of something is how good it is.
examples: The quality of this fabric is excellent; it is very soft and strong.

words.definition: A space is an empty area.
examples: There is a parking space available near the entrance.

words.definition: Stairs are the things that are used to walk up or down in a building.
examples: He walked up the stairs to the second floor.

words.definition: A symbol is a thing that stands for something else.
examples: The dove is often used as a symbol of peace.

words.definition: If someone or something is thin, they are not fat.
examples: The book is very thin; it only has fifty pages.

words.definition: People study accounting so they can deal with money and finance properly.
examples: He works in the accounting department of a large bank.

words.definition: To appeal to someone is to be interesting or attractive.
examples: Bright colors usually appeal to small children.

words.definition: To assume something is to think that it is true, even with no proof.
examples: I assume he is coming to the party, but I haven't asked him yet.

words.definition: To borrow something is to take it and then give it back later.
examples: Can I borrow your pen for a moment?

words.definition: A client is a person or business that pays another to do a service.
examples: The lawyer met with her client to discuss the case.

words.definition: The downtown area is the center of most cities.
examples: We went downtown to see the new movie theater.

words.definition: If something is dull, it is not exciting.
examples: The lecture was so dull that I almost fell asleep.

words.definition: To embarrass people is to make them feel ashamed or foolish.
examples: I didn't mean to embarrass you in front of your friends.

words.definition: A fare is an amount of money paid to use a bus, train, or taxi.
examples: The bus fare has increased by fifty cents this year.

words.definition: Former describes something that used to be but is not anymore.
examples: The former champion lost the match today.

words.definition: To found a company or organization means to start it.
examples: He wants to found a charity to help homeless animals.

words.definition: To invest means to use money in a way that will bring a profit later.
examples: She decided to invest her savings in the stock market.

words.definition: A loan is something, usually money, that one person lends to another.
examples: He took out a loan from the bank to buy a new car.

words.definition: If something is practical, it is useful.
examples: Learning to cook is a very practical skill.

words.definition: A quarter is 1/4 or 25% of something.
examples: He ate a quarter of the pizza by himself.

words.definition: A salary is how much money a person makes at his or her job.
examples: She received a raise in her salary because of her hard work.

words.definition: A scholarship is money given so someone can go to school.
examples: He studied hard to win a scholarship to the university.

words.definition: If something is temporary, it exists for a short time.
examples: This job is only temporary until I find a permanent one.

words.definition: A treasure is a collection of valuable things, especially jewels or gold.
examples: The divers found a chest of treasure at the bottom of the sea.

words.definition: To urge someone is to try very hard to get them to do something.
examples: I urge you to wear a seatbelt when you drive.

words.definition: A coach is a person who teaches sports.
examples: The coach told the team to run two more laps.

words.definition: To control something is to make it do what you want.
examples: It is difficult to control the car on icy roads.

words.definition: A description of someone or something says what they are like.
examples: She gave the police a detailed description of the thief.

words.definition: If something is direct, it goes straight between two places.
examples: This is a direct flight from London to New York.

words.definition: An exam is a test.
examples: I have to study all night for my math exam.

words.definition: An example of something is a thing that is typical of it.
examples: Can you give me an example of a healthy snack?

words.definition: A limit is the largest or smallest amount of something that you allow.
examples: There is a time limit of one hour for the test.

words.definition: If something is local, it is nearby.
examples: We buy our vegetables from the local farmers' market.

words.definition: Magical describes a quality that makes someone or something special.
examples: The fireworks display created a magical atmosphere.

words.definition: Mail is letters and other things sent to people.
examples: I checked the mailbox, but there was no mail for me today.

words.definition: A novel is a book that tells a story.
examples: Harry Potter is a very famous novel.

words.definition: An outline is the plan for a story or essay.
examples: Before writing the report, make an outline of your main points.

words.definition: A poet is a person who writes poems.
examples: Emily Dickinson is a famous American poet.

words.definition: To print something is to put it onto paper.
examples: I need to print my essay before class starts.

words.definition: A scene is one part of a book or movie.
examples: The final scene of the movie was very sad.

words.definition: A sheet is a thin flat piece of paper.
examples: Take a clean sheet of paper and write your name.

words.definition: People who are silly show a lack of serious thought.
examples: Stop making silly faces in the photo.

words.definition: A store is a place where you can buy things.
examples: I am going to the grocery store to buy milk.

words.definition: To suffer is to feel pain.
examples: He suffers from bad headaches when he is stressed.

words.definition: Technology is new things made by using science.
examples: Computers are an important part of modern technology.

words.definition: To go across something is to go to the other side of it.
examples: They built a bridge across the wide river.

words.definition: To breathe means to let air go in and out of your body.
examples: It is hard to breathe when the air is polluted.

words.definition: A characteristic is something that shows what a person or a thing is like.
examples: One characteristic of tigers is their black stripes.

words.definition: To consume something means to eat or drink it.
examples: He consumes a lot of water after exercising.

words.definition: To excite someone means to make them happy and interested.
examples: The news about the trip will excite the children.

words.definition: If something is extremely good, it is very, very good.
examples: The exam was extremely difficult for everyone.

words.definition: Fear is the feeling of being afraid.
examples: He overcame his fear of heights by climbing the tower.

words.definition: If you are fortunate, you are lucky.
examples: We were fortunate to find a parking spot right in front of the store.

words.definition: If someone happens to do something, he or she does it by chance.
examples: I happened to see my teacher at the grocery store yesterday.

words.definition: The length of something is how long it is from one end to the other.
examples: The length of the swimming pool is 50 meters.

words.definition: A mistake is something you do wrong.
examples: It was a mistake to leave the window open during the rain.

words.definition: To observe something is to watch it.
examples: The scientist wants to observe how the birds build their nests.

words.definition: An opportunity is a chance to do something.
examples: The internship is a great opportunity to learn about the business.

words.definition: A prize is something of value that is given to the winner.
examples: The first prize in the competition is a new bicycle.

words.definition: A race is a contest to see who is the fastest.
examples: He trained hard to win the 100-meter race.

words.definition: To realize is to suddenly understand.
examples: I didn't realize that the meeting had already started.

words.definition: To respond is to give an answer to what someone else said.
examples: Please respond to my email as soon as possible.

words.definition: A risk is a chance of something bad happening.
examples: Smoking increases the risk of lung disease.

words.definition: To wonder is to ask yourself questions or have a need to know.
examples: I wonder what time the movie starts.

words.definition: Yet is used to say something has not happened up to now.
examples: I haven't finished my homework yet.

words.definition: Art is something creative that expresses ideas and feelings.
examples: She visited the museum to see the works of modern art.

words.definition: A book is a set of printed sheets of paper that are held together inside a cover.
examples: I borrowed a history book from the library.

words.definition: Clothes are what people wear to cover their bodies.
examples: He bought some new clothes for his job interview.

words.definition: A community is a group of people who share the same area or interests.
examples: The local community came together to clean up the park.

words.definition: December is the twelfth month of the year.
examples: It usually starts snowing here in December.

words.definition: Dinner is the main meal eaten in the evening.
examples: We are having roast chicken for dinner tonight.

words.definition: To end is to stop or finish.
examples: The movie will end in about five minutes.

words.definition: To exchange is to give one thing in return for another.
examples: They decided to exchange phone numbers after the meeting.

words.definition: A family is a group of people who are related to each other.
examples: My whole family gathers at my grandmother's house on holidays.

words.definition: From shows a starting place or position.
examples: The flight from London has just arrived.

words.definition: Green is the color of growing grass or leaves.
examples: The fields turn green in the spring.

words.definition: A person's home is the place where that person lives.
examples: I can't wait to get home and relax on the sofa.

words.definition: January is the first month of the year.
examples: Many people make new goals in January.

words.definition: Red is the color of blood.
examples: She wrote the important note in red ink.

words.definition: Seven is the word for the number 7.
examples: There are seven colors in a rainbow.

words.definition: To start is to begin doing something.
examples: The concert will start at 8 PM sharp.

words.definition: Together shows an action is done with another person or thing.
examples: We prefer to study together rather than alone.

words.definition: A university is a school where people study for a degree.
examples: He wants to go to a university to study medicine.

words.definition: To wear is to have clothing on your body.
examples: You should wear a warm jacket because it is cold outside.

words.definition: A year is a period of 365 days or twelve months.
examples: She plans to travel around the world next year.

words.definition: To appreciate something is to understand its good qualities.
examples: I really appreciate your kindness and support.

words.definition: If something is available, it means you can get it.
examples: This shirt is available in three different colors.

words.definition: To beat someone means to do better than they do.
examples: Our team hopes to beat the champions this year.

words.definition: If something is bright, it gives off a lot of light.
examples: The stars were very bright in the night sky.

words.definition: To celebrate is to do something to show that an event is special.
examples: We will celebrate the victory with a big party.

words.definition: To decide is to make a definite choice.
examples: He needs to decide which college to attend.

words.definition: To disappear means to go away or not be seen.
examples: The sun began to disappear behind the clouds.

words.definition: If you talk about something else, you talk about something different.
examples: If you don't like pizza, we can eat something else.

words.definition: Fair means reasonable or right.
examples: It is important to play fair in every game.

words.definition: To flow is to move easily and continuously in one direction.
examples: Water flows downhill into the valley.

words.definition: If you move forward, you move in the direction in front of you.
examples: The crowd moved forward to see the stage better.

words.definition: A hill is a raised area of land. It is higher than the land around it.
examples: We climbed to the top of the hill to watch the sunset.

words.definition: A level is a point on a scale that measures something.
examples: The noise level in the room was too high.

words.definition: A lone person or thing is the only one in a given place.
examples: A lone tree stood in the middle of the field.

words.definition: A puddle is a pool of liquid on the ground.
examples: The rain left a large puddle on the sidewalk.

words.definition: A response is the answer to a question.
examples: His response to the teacher's question was correct.

words.definition: A season is a time of the year: spring, summer, fall, or winter.
examples: Winter is the coldest season of the year.

words.definition: A solution is a way to solve a problem.
examples: They discussed the best solution for fixing the broken car.

words.definition: To waste means to use something carelessly and unnecessarily.
examples: Don't waste your money on things you don't need.

words.definition: You use whether when you must choose between two things.
examples: I asked him whether he wanted tea or coffee.

words.definition: Always means that something happens all the time.
examples: She always brushes her teeth before bed.

words.definition: To ask is to say or write something to get an answer.
examples: You should ask for help if you don't understand the lesson.

words.definition: A banana is a long yellow fruit with soft white flesh inside.
examples: He peeled a banana for his afternoon snack.

words.definition: Bread is a food made from flour and water.
examples: I like to eat fresh bread with butter and jam.

words.definition: Cake is a sweet dessert made from flour, water, sugar, and eggs.
examples: We cut the cake after singing 'Happy Birthday'.

words.definition: A carrot is an orange vegetable.
examples: Chopped carrot adds a nice crunch to the salad.

words.definition: Chicken is a bird that is often used for food.
examples: Grilled chicken is a healthy dinner option.

words.definition: Chocolate is a sweet food made from cacao beans.
examples: Dark chocolate is my favorite type of candy.

words.definition: To contain is to hold or have something.
examples: This bottle contains pure orange juice.

words.definition: If a food is delicious, it is tasty.
examples: The homemade apple pie was absolutely delicious.

words.definition: A diet is the food regularly eaten by a person.
examples: A balanced diet includes plenty of fruits and vegetables.

words.definition: To eat is to chew and swallow food.
examples: We usually eat lunch at 12:30 PM.

words.definition: Food is things people and animals eat.
examples: There was plenty of food at the buffet.

words.definition: Fruit is a type of healthy food that grows on trees and plants.
examples: Apples and oranges are popular types of fruit.

words.definition: When something is great, it is very good.
examples: We had a great time at the amusement park.

words.definition: Health is the state of a person's body.
examples: Good health is more important than money.

words.definition: A recipe is a set of instructions for cooking a certain type of food.
examples: I followed the recipe carefully to make the cookies.

words.definition: A restaurant is a business where people sit and eat food.
examples: We celebrated our anniversary at a fancy restaurant.

words.definition: If something is special, it is unique and different.
examples: This necklace is very special to me because it was a gift.

words.definition: Water is a clear liquid that people need to survive.
examples: You should drink a glass of water after exercising.

words.definition: Someone or something that is alive is not dead.
examples: The rescued hiker was found alive and well.

words.definition: A bone is a hard part of the body.
examples: The skeleton is made up of many different bones.

words.definition: To bother is to make the effort to do something.
examples: He didn't bother to lock the door when he left.

words.definition: A captain is the person who controls a ship or airplane.
examples: The captain announced that we would be landing soon.

words.definition: The conclusion of something is the final part of it.
examples: In conclusion, the project was a great success.

words.definition: Doubt is a feeling of not being sure.
examples: I have some doubt about whether this plan will work.

words.definition: To explore is to look for new places.
examples: The children went into the woods to explore.

words.definition: If you are glad, you are happy.
examples: I am very glad to see you again.

words.definition: However means despite or not being influenced by something.
examples: The hike was difficult; however, the view was worth it.

words.definition: Injustice is a lack of fairness or justice.
examples: They marched in the streets to protest against injustice.

words.definition: If something is international, it involves more than one country.
examples: She works for a large international company.

words.definition: A lawyer works with the law and represents people in court.
examples: You should call a lawyer if you have legal problems.

words.definition: To mention something is to talk about it.
examples: Did he mention why he was late?

words.definition: Someone who is old has lived for many years.
examples: The old castle has been standing for centuries.

words.definition: A policy is a rule.
examples: The store has a strict no-return policy on sale items.

words.definition: If something is social, it is about many people in a community.
examples: Social media helps people stay connected.

words.definition: To achieve something is to successfully do it after trying hard.
examples: If you practice daily, you will achieve your dream.

words.definition: To advise someone is to tell them what to do.
examples: Doctors advise patients to quit smoking.

words.definition: If something happens already, it happens before a certain time.
examples: When I arrived, the movie had already started.

words.definition: If something is basic, it is very simple or easy.
examples: He taught us the basic rules of chess.

words.definition: A bit is a small amount of something.
examples: I felt a bit tired after the long walk.

words.definition: To consider something means to think about it.
examples: We should consider all options before making a choice.

words.definition: To destroy means to damage something so badly that it cannot be used.
examples: The fire threatened to destroy the entire forest.

words.definition: To entertain someone is to do something that they enjoy.
examples: He likes to entertain his guests with magic tricks.

words.definition: If something is extra, it is more than what is needed.
examples: She cooked extra food in case more guests arrived.

words.definition: A goal is something you work toward.
examples: His main goal is to become a professional engineer.

words.definition: To lie is to say or write something untrue to deceive someone.
examples: He taught his children never to lie.

words.definition: Meat is food made of animals.
examples: They grilled some meat on the barbecue.

words.definition: An opinion is a thought about a person or a thing.
examples: In my opinion, that was the best movie of the year.

words.definition: If something is real, it actually exists.
examples: The flowers look so perfect, but they are not real.

words.definition: To reflect is when a surface sends back light, heat, sound or an image.
examples: The mirror will reflect your image.

words.definition: To regard people is to think of them in a certain way.
examples: Many people regard him as a hero.

words.definition: To serve someone is to give them food or drinks.
examples: The waiter came to serve our dinner.

words.definition: A vegetable is a plant used as food.
examples: Spinach is a green vegetable rich in iron.

words.definition: A war is a big fight between two groups of people.
examples: The two nations were at war for many years.

words.definition: If something is worth an amount of money, it costs that amount.
examples: This antique watch is worth a lot of money.

words.definition: To appear is to seem.
examples: She appeared to be very tired after the long trip.

words.definition: The base is the bottom of something.
examples: The lamp has a heavy metal base so it won't fall over.

words.definition: The brain is the organ in your head that lets you think.
examples: The brain controls all the movements of your body.

words.definition: A career is a job that you do for a large part of your life.
examples: He started his career as a teacher twenty years ago.

words.definition: A clerk is a type of worker. Clerks in a store help customers.
examples: The hotel clerk gave us the key to our room.

words.definition: Effort is hard work or an attempt to do something.
examples: It takes a lot of effort to learn a new language.

words.definition: To enter a place is to go into it.
examples: Please knock on the door before you enter the office.

words.definition: When something is excellent, it is very good.
examples: The food at that Italian restaurant is excellent.

words.definition: A hero is a brave person who does things to help others.
examples: The firefighter was called a hero for saving the child.

words.definition: To hurry is to do something quickly.
examples: We need to hurry or we will miss the bus.

words.definition: To inform someone is to tell them about something.
examples: Please inform me if your phone number changes.

words.definition: Later means after the present, expected, or usual time.
examples: I will call you back later this afternoon.

words.definition: To leave means to go away from someone or something.
examples: It is time to leave for the airport now.

words.definition: To locate something is to find it.
examples: Can you help me locate my glasses on the desk?

words.definition: A nurse is a person who helps sick people in the hospital.
examples: The nurse checked the patient's temperature every hour.

words.definition: An operation is when a doctor replaces or removes something in the body.
examples: He needs a knee operation to play soccer again.

words.definition: Pain is the feeling that you have when you are hurt.
examples: She felt a sharp pain in her arm after falling.

words.definition: To refuse something is to say "no" to it.
examples: I refuse to eat anything with onions in it.

words.definition: Though is used when one idea makes another seem surprising.
examples: Though it was raining, they went for a walk.

words.definition: If something is various, there are many types of it.
examples: The store sells various kinds of cheese.

words.definition: Actual means real or true.
examples: The actual cost of the repair was higher than the estimate.

words.definition: To amaze people is to surprise them very much.
examples: The magician's tricks will amaze the audience.

words.definition: A charge is the price to pay for something.
examples: Is there a charge for using the swimming pool?

words.definition: To comfort someone means to make them feel better.
examples: The mother tried to comfort her crying baby.

words.definition: To contact people is to speak or write to them.
examples: You can contact me by email if you have questions.

words.definition: A customer is a person who buys something at a store.
examples: The customer asked the sales clerk for a different size.

words.definition: To deliver something is to take it from one place to another.
examples: The mail carrier will deliver the package tomorrow.

words.definition: To earn means to get money for the work you do.
examples: She works two jobs to earn enough money for college.

words.definition: A gate is a type of door. Gates are usually made of metal or wood.
examples: Please close the garden gate so the dog doesn't get out.

words.definition: To include something means to have it as part of a group.
examples: Does the price of the meal include a drink?

words.definition: To manage something means to control or be in charge of it.
examples: He was hired to manage the new branch of the bank.

words.definition: A mystery is something that is difficult to understand or explain.
examples: Where the lost keys went remains a mystery.

words.definition: To occur means to happen.
examples: Accidents often occur at this busy intersection.

words.definition: If A is the opposite of B, A is completely different from B.
examples: The opposite of 'hot' is 'cold'.

words.definition: A plate is a flat round thing that you put food on.
examples: She put a piece of cake on the plate.

words.definition: To receive something is to get it.
examples: Did you receive the letter I sent you last week?

words.definition: A reward is something given in exchange for good behavior or work.
examples: The parents gave their son a reward for his good grades.

words.definition: To set something is to put it somewhere.
examples: Please set the vase on the table carefully.

words.definition: To steal is to take something that is not yours.
examples: It is wrong to steal money from other people.

words.definition: A thief is someone who quietly takes things that do not belong to them.
examples: The thief stole the painting from the museum at night.

words.definition: To advance is to go forward.
examples: The army began to advance towards the city.

words.definition: An athlete is a person who plays sports.
examples: She is a great athlete who plays both soccer and tennis.

words.definition: If something is average, it is at a normal level.
examples: The average temperature in July is usually very high.

words.definition: Your behavior is the way you act.
examples: The teacher was pleased with the student's good behavior.

words.definition: Behind means to be at the back of something.
examples: The cat is hiding behind the sofa.

words.definition: A course is a class in school.
examples: I am taking a history course this semester.

words.definition: To lower something is to make it go down.
examples: Please lower the volume of the TV.

words.definition: To match is to be the same or similar.
examples: Her shoes match her handbag perfectly.

words.definition: A member is a person who is part of a group.
examples: He is a member of the local swimming club.

words.definition: If something is mental, it has to do with your mind.
examples: Solving puzzles is a good mental exercise.

words.definition: A passenger is a person who rides in a car, train, or airplane.
examples: The passenger asked the taxi driver to stop.

words.definition: Your personality is what you are like and how you behave.
examples: She has a very kind and friendly personality.

words.definition: A poem is a short kind of writing.
examples: He wrote a romantic poem for his wife.

words.definition: A pole is a long thin stick made of wood or metal that supports things.
examples: The flag was flying at the top of the pole.

words.definition: To remove something is to take it away.
examples: Please remove your hat when you are inside the building.

words.definition: Safety means the condition of being safe and free from danger.
examples: Wear a helmet for your safety while riding a bike.

words.definition: To shoot is to fire something like a bullet at someone or something.
examples: The archer prepared to shoot the arrow at the target.

words.definition: To sound means to make a noise.
examples: The alarm will sound if you open that door.

words.definition: To swim is to move through water.
examples: We like to swim in the ocean during our vacation.

words.definition: A web is a home made by a spider.
examples: The spider caught a fly in its web.

words.definition: A block is a solid piece of wood, stone, or ice.
examples: The builder used a concrete block for the foundation.

words.definition: To bury something, you put it under the ground or under a lot of other things.
examples: Pirates used to bury their treasure on islands.

words.definition: To cheer is to give a loud shout of approval or encouragement.
examples: The crowd began to cheer for their favorite player.

words.definition: If something is complex, it has many small parts. It is hard to understand.
examples: The instructions for this machine are very complex.

words.definition: A critic is someone who gives opinions about movies, books, plays, etc.
examples: The movie critic gave the film five stars.

words.definition: A direction is the way to go.
examples: He pointed in the direction of the nearest gas station.

words.definition: An event is something that happens, especially something important.
examples: The wedding was the biggest event of the year for our family.

words.definition: To exercise is to run or play sports so that you can be healthy.
examples: I try to exercise every morning before work.

words.definition: Friendship is the relationship between people who are friends.
examples: Their friendship began when they were in kindergarten.

words.definition: A guide is someone who shows you where to go.
examples: The tour guide led us through the ancient ruins.

words.definition: If there is a lack of something, there is not enough of it.
examples: The plant died because of a lack of water.

words.definition: To perform is to do something in front of people who watch.
examples: The children will perform a play for their parents.

words.definition: Pressure is what you apply to make someone do something.
examples: He felt a lot of pressure to succeed in his new job.

words.definition: If something will probably happen, it is likely to happen.
examples: It's very cloudy; it will probably rain soon.

words.definition: If something is public, it is meant for everyone to use.
examples: The park is a public space where anyone can go.

words.definition: Smart means intelligent.
examples: She is a smart girl who always gets good grades.

words.definition: To strike people or things is to hit them.
examples: He used a hammer to strike the nail.

words.definition: To support something is to like it and help it be successful.
examples: My friends support me in everything I do.

words.definition: A term is a word for something.
examples: The scientific term for salt is sodium chloride.

words.definition: To unite is to get together to do something.
examples: The workers decided to unite to ask for better pay.

words.definition: To associate means to connect something with a person or thing.
examples: Most people associate ice cream with summer.

words.definition: The environment is the place where people work or live.
examples: We need to keep our environment clean for future generations.

words.definition: A factory is a building where things are made or put together.
examples: My uncle works in a car factory.

words.definition: A feature is an important part of something.
examples: The best feature of this house is the large garden.

words.definition: An instance is an example of something.
examples: For instance, you can use a fork to eat pasta.

words.definition: To involve means to include as an active participant.
examples: The game involves running and catching a ball.

words.definition: Medicine is something you take to feel better or treat an illness.
examples: The doctor gave me some medicine for my headache.

words.definition: A mix is different things put together.
examples: The cake batter is a mix of flour, sugar, and eggs.

words.definition: To organize is to plan or get ready for an event.
examples: She helped organize the charity fundraiser.

words.definition: A period is an amount of time when something happens.
examples: He studied abroad for a period of six months.

words.definition: If people populate an area, they live there.
examples: Millions of people populate the city of Tokyo.

words.definition: To produce something is to make or grow it.
examples: This farm produces delicious corn and potatoes.

words.definition: A range is a number or a set of similar things.
examples: The restaurant has a wide range of desserts.

words.definition: To recognize something is to know it because you have seen it before.
examples: I didn't recognize her with her new haircut.

words.definition: If something is regular, it happens often and in equal amounts of time.
examples: He has a regular workout routine at the gym.

words.definition: A sign is an indication giving information, directions, a warning, etc.
examples: There is a stop sign at the end of the street.

words.definition: A tip is a pointed end of something.
examples: The tip of the pencil broke when I dropped it.

words.definition: A tradition is something people have been doing for a long time.
examples: Watching fireworks on New Year's Eve is a popular tradition.

words.definition: Trash is waste material or unwanted or worthless things.
examples: Don't forget to take out the trash tonight.

words.definition: If something is wide, it is large from side to side.
examples: The road is wide enough for three cars.

words.definition: Advice is an opinion about what to do.
examples: My father gave me some good advice about saving money.

words.definition: Along means down the length of a road, river, etc.
examples: We walked along the river bank for an hour.

words.definition: Attention is the notice, thought, or consideration of someone.
examples: The teacher asked for the students' attention before starting the lesson.

words.definition: To attract means to make a person or thing come closer or be interested.
examples: The bright flowers attract many bees and butterflies.

words.definition: To climb means to use your hands and feet to go up something.
examples: The children like to climb the big oak tree in the park.

words.definition: To drop is to fall or allow something to fall.
examples: Be careful not to drop the glass vase.

words.definition: If something is final, it is the last part.
examples: The final exam will be held next Friday.

words.definition: Further means at or from a greater distance or time.
examples: The library is further down the road than I thought.

words.definition: To imply something is to suggest it without saying it.
examples: Her smile seemed to imply that she knew the secret.

words.definition: To maintain means to make something stay the same.
examples: He exercises daily to maintain a healthy weight.

words.definition: You use neither to connect two negative possibilities.
examples: Neither the red shirt nor the blue one fits me.

words.definition: Otherwise means in another way if you don't do this.
examples: You must hurry; otherwise, you will miss the train.

words.definition: If something is physical, it is related to your body and not your mind.
examples: Construction work requires a lot of physical strength.

words.definition: To prove something is to show that it is true.
examples: You need your ID to prove your age.

words.definition: To react is to respond by acting in a certain way.
examples: How did he react when he heard the good news?

words.definition: To ride something is to travel on it. You can ride an animal, a bike, etc.
examples: I learned to ride a bike when I was six years old.

words.definition: If something is situated somewhere, it is in that place.
examples: The hotel is situated near the city center.

words.definition: Society is a group of people who interact and share a culture.
examples: We live in a multicultural society with many traditions.

words.definition: A standard is what people consider normal or good.
examples: The safety standard for this car is very high.

words.definition: To suggest something means to give an idea or plan about it.
examples: I suggest we go to the Italian restaurant for dinner.

words.definition: Actually means in fact or really.
examples: I thought he was joking, but he was actually serious.

words.definition: Bite is the act of using your teeth to cut and tear into something.
examples: He took a big bite of the juicy apple.

words.definition: The coast is the land by an ocean.
examples: We drove along the California coast to enjoy the view.

words.definition: A deal is an agreement that you have with another person.
examples: They shook hands to make a deal.

words.definition: The desert is an area of land without many plants or water.
examples: It is very hot in the desert during the day.

words.definition: If something is effective, it works well.
examples: This cleaning spray is very effective against grease.

words.definition: To examine something is to look at it carefully.
examples: The detective examined the room for clues.

words.definition: If something is false, it is not correct.
examples: The witness gave a false statement to the police.

words.definition: When you figure something out, you come to understand it and find an answer.
examples: I can't figure out how to solve this math problem.

words.definition: A gift is something you give someone.
examples: She wrapped the gift in colorful paper.

words.definition: Hunger is the feeling that you get when you need to eat.
examples: He felt faint from hunger because he skipped lunch.

words.definition: To imagine something is to think of it in your mind.
examples: Can you imagine what it would be like to fly?

words.definition: A journey is a long trip.
examples: The journey to the mountains took five hours.

words.definition: A puzzle is something that is hard to understand.
examples: The disappearance of the cat is a puzzle to us.

words.definition: Quite means that something is a certain way completely or very much.
examples: It is quite cold outside, so wear a coat.

words.definition: Rather is used when you want to do one thing but not the other.
examples: I would rather read a book than watch TV.

words.definition: If something is specific, it is precise or exact.
examples: She gave specific instructions on how to bake the cake.

words.definition: A spider is a small creature with eight legs.
examples: A large spider spun a web in the corner of the room.

words.definition: A tour is a short trip in which you see many sights.
examples: We took a bus tour of London.

words.definition: A trip is a journey to a certain place.
examples: We are planning a trip to Paris next summer.

words.definition: A band is a group of people who play music.
examples: My brother plays drums in a rock band.

words.definition: Barely means by the smallest amount, almost not.
examples: I was so tired that I could barely keep my eyes open.

words.definition: If something is boring, it is not fun.
examples: The movie was boring, so we left early.

words.definition: To cancel means to decide that an event or a request will not happen.
examples: We had to cancel the meeting because the boss was sick.

words.definition: A driveway is a short private road that leads to a person's home.
examples: He parked his car in the driveway.

words.definition: Garbage is waste material like unwanted or spoiled food, bottles, paper, etc.
examples: Please put the empty cans in the garbage.

words.definition: An instrument is something designed to do a certain task like play music.
examples: The piano is a beautiful musical instrument.

words.definition: A list is a record of information printed with an item on each line.
examples: She checked her to-do list to see what was next.

words.definition: Magic is the power to do impossible things.
examples: The magician performed amazing magic tricks.

words.definition: A message is a set of words that you send to someone.
examples: I sent a text message to my friend.

words.definition: To notice something is to see it for the first time.
examples: Did you notice the new painting in the hallway?

words.definition: To own something means to have it. That thing belongs to you.
examples: They own a small cottage by the lake.

words.definition: To predict something is to say that it will happen.
examples: The weatherman can predict when it will snow.

words.definition: A professor is a person who teaches in college.
examples: My math professor explains things very clearly.

words.definition: To rush is to go somewhere or do something very quickly.
examples: Don't rush; take your time to finish the work correctly.

words.definition: A schedule is a plan that tells you when to do things.
examples: According to the schedule, the bus arrives at 9:00 AM.

words.definition: To share something is to give some of it to another person.
examples: Can you share your umbrella with me?

words.definition: A stage is a place where actors or musicians act or sing.
examples: The actors bowed on the stage after the play.

words.definition: A storm is very bad weather. There is a lot of rain or snow.
examples: The storm caused a power outage in our neighborhood.

words.definition: You use within to say that something is inside another thing.
examples: You must finish the test within one hour.

words.definition: A burden is a serious or difficult responsibility.
examples: Carrying all these heavy boxes is a big burden.

words.definition: To compromise is to agree to something that is not exactly what you want.
examples: In a marriage, you often have to compromise.

words.definition: To craft something is to make it using skill.
examples: He used wood to craft a beautiful toy boat.

words.definition: When you dive into water, you go down head first into the water.
examples: He likes to dive off the high board at the pool.

words.definition: When people or things are fragile, they are not strong and can be damaged easily.
examples: Handle the box carefully because the contents are fragile.

words.definition: If you cut something into two parts that are the same size, you cut it half.
examples: Please cut the apple in half.

words.definition: Innocence is a lack of experience of difficult or complex things in life.
examples: The jury believed in the prisoner's innocence.

words.definition: When you lead something, you go first and it follows you.
examples: You can lead the horse to water, but you can't make it drink.

words.definition: When you have a meeting, you are with other people.
examples: The business meeting started at 10 AM.

words.definition: To merge two things is to combine them into one whole thing.
examples: The two companies decided to merge.

words.definition: When something is moderate, it is not too big or too small in size or amount.
examples: The doctor advised him to do a moderate amount of exercise.

words.definition: To overwhelm is to exist in such a large amount that someone cannot deal with it.
examples: The number of emails I receive daily can overwhelm me.

words.definition: When you make a payment, you give someone some money for what you get.
examples: She made a payment on her credit card bill.

words.definition: A perception of a situation is a way of thinking about it or understanding it.
examples: Drugs can alter your perception of reality.

words.definition: When you settle something, you reach an agreement.
examples: We need to settle this dispute before it gets worse.

words.definition: A shiver is a shaking movement the body makes when someone is cold or scared.
examples: She felt a shiver when she walked into the cold room.

words.definition: When someone is sociable, they are friendly.
examples: Dogs are usually very sociable animals.

words.definition: When you speed, you go very fast.
examples: It is dangerous to speed on icy roads.

words.definition: When someone is talkative, he or she talks a lot.
examples: My little sister is very talkative in the morning.

words.definition: When something is usual, it is what we expect.
examples: I'll have my usual breakfast of toast and coffee.

words.definition: If something is above, it is at a higher level than something else.
examples: The birds flew high above the clouds.

words.definition: If something is ahead of something else, it is in front of it.
examples: Look ahead to see where you are going.

words.definition: An amount is how much there is of something.
examples: Please pay the full amount by the due date.

words.definition: A belief is a strong feeling that something is correct or true.
examples: It is my belief that everyone deserves kindness.

words.definition: The center of something is the middle of it.
examples: We met in the center of the town square.

words.definition: If something is common, it happens often or there is much of it.
examples: Sparrows are a very common bird in this area.

words.definition: To cost is to require payment.
examples: The new video game will cost fifty dollars.

words.definition: To demonstrate something is to show how it is done.
examples: The teacher will demonstrate the experiment first.

words.definition: Different describes someone or something that is not the same as others.
examples: Everyone has a different opinion on the movie.

words.definition: Evidence is a fact or thing that you use to prove something.
examples: There is no scientific evidence to support that claim.

words.definition: Honesty means the quality of being truthful or honest.
examples: Honesty is essential for a good relationship.

words.definition: An idiom is a phrase with a meaning different from its words.
examples: 'It's raining cats and dogs' is an idiom.

words.definition: If something is independent, it is not controlled by something else.
examples: The United States became an independent country in 1776.

words.definition: Inside means the inner part, space or side of something.
examples: It was warm inside the house.

words.definition: A jail is a place to keep bad people.
examples: He spent the night in jail for fighting.

words.definition: A master is a person who is very good at something.
examples: Picasso was a master of modern art.

words.definition: A memory is something you remember.
examples: This photo brings back a happy memory.

words.definition: A pocket is a part of your clothing where you can keep things.
examples: I have some coins in my jacket pocket.

words.definition: If something is proper, it is right.
examples: It is proper to say 'thank you' when someone helps you.

words.definition: If something is for sale, you can buy it.
examples: They put a 'For Sale' sign in the car window.
